I have this (attached image) in an org file. I want to change the stuff labeled (2), where I have the `<some command> <descripton>` to be `<description>: <command>` as on line (1).

In VS code or atom I would use `alt+click` to give me multiple cursors just after each `<some command>`, Then do `S end` to select to the end of the line, `C x` to cut, `home` to go to the beginning of the line, then `C v` to paste. I've done a bit of googling, but can't exactly sort it. Any suggestions?

text: There are two different packages which are enabled by this module. One is a “simple” version which ist triggered by <CMD-D> (the `evil-multiedit` pkg) and another one where you can set indidual cursors with `gzz` for example (`evil-mc` ) pkg. The latter might work for you…
